philjs-ui Component Library

A collection of accessible, customizable UI components built for PhilJS. All components are unstyled by default and designed to be styled with Tailwind CSS.

Installation

1pnpm add philjs-ui

Components

Button

A flexible button component with multiple variants and sizes.

Example

1import { Button } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <>
6      <Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
7      <Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
8      <Button variant="outline">Outline</Button>
9      <Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
10      <Button variant="destructive">Delete</Button>
11      <Button size="sm">Small</Button>
12      <Button size="lg">Large</Button>
13      <Button loading>Loading...</Button>
14      <Button disabled>Disabled</Button>
15    </>
16  );
17}

Props

PropTypeDefault
variant"primary" | "secondary" | "outline" | "ghost" | "destructive""primary"
size"sm" | "md" | "lg""md"
loadingbooleanfalse
disabledbooleanfalse
asChildbooleanfalse

Input

Text input with label, error state, and description support.

Example

1import { Input } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <>
6      <Input label="Email" type="email" placeholder="you@example.com" />
7      <Input label="Password" type="password" error="Password is required" />
8      <Input label="Bio" description="Tell us about yourself" />
9      <Input disabled value="Read only" />
10    </>
11  );
12}

Props

PropTypeDefault
labelstring-
errorstring-
descriptionstring-
typestring"text"

Select

Accessible dropdown select with search and multi-select support.

Example

1import { Select } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <Select
6      label="Country"
7      options={[
8        { value: 'us', label: 'United States' },
9        { value: 'uk', label: 'United Kingdom' },
10        { value: 'ca', label: 'Canada' },
11      ]}
12      onChange={(value) => console.log(value)}
13    />
14  );
15}

Props

PropTypeDefault
optionsArray<{ value: string; label: string }>-
valuestring-
onChange(value: string) => void-
labelstring-
placeholderstring-
searchablebooleanfalse
multiplebooleanfalse

Dialog

Modal dialog with focus trap and keyboard navigation.

Example

1import { Dialog, Button } from 'philjs-ui';
2import { createSignal } from 'philjs-core';
3 
4function Example() {
5  const [open, setOpen] = createSignal(false);
6 
7  return (
8    <>
9      <Button onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>Open Dialog</Button>
10 
11      <Dialog open={open()} onClose={() => setOpen(false)}>
12        <Dialog.Title>Confirm Action</Dialog.Title>
13        <Dialog.Description>
14          Are you sure you want to continue?
15        </Dialog.Description>
16        <Dialog.Footer>
17          <Button variant="ghost" onClick={() => setOpen(false)}>
18            Cancel
19          </Button>
20          <Button onClick={() => setOpen(false)}>
21            Confirm
22          </Button>
23        </Dialog.Footer>
24      </Dialog>
25    </>
26  );
27}

Props

PropTypeDefault
openboolean-
onClose() => void-
initialFocusRefObject<HTMLElement>-

Tabs

Accessible tabbed interface with keyboard navigation.

Example

1import { Tabs } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <Tabs defaultValue="account">
6      <Tabs.List>
7        <Tabs.Trigger value="account">Account</Tabs.Trigger>
8        <Tabs.Trigger value="password">Password</Tabs.Trigger>
9        <Tabs.Trigger value="notifications">Notifications</Tabs.Trigger>
10      </Tabs.List>
11 
12      <Tabs.Content value="account">
13        <p>Manage your account settings here.</p>
14      </Tabs.Content>
15      <Tabs.Content value="password">
16        <p>Change your password here.</p>
17      </Tabs.Content>
18      <Tabs.Content value="notifications">
19        <p>Configure your notification preferences.</p>
20      </Tabs.Content>
21    </Tabs>
22  );
23}

Props

PropTypeDefault
defaultValuestring-
valuestring-
onChange(value: string) => void-
orientation"horizontal" | "vertical""horizontal"

Accordion

Collapsible content sections.

Example

1import { Accordion } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <Accordion type="single" collapsible>
6      <Accordion.Item value="item-1">
7        <Accordion.Trigger>What is PhilJS?</Accordion.Trigger>
8        <Accordion.Content>
9          PhilJS is a modern web framework with fine-grained reactivity.
10        </Accordion.Content>
11      </Accordion.Item>
12      <Accordion.Item value="item-2">
13        <Accordion.Trigger>How do signals work?</Accordion.Trigger>
14        <Accordion.Content>
15          Signals are reactive primitives that automatically track dependencies.
16        </Accordion.Content>
17      </Accordion.Item>
18    </Accordion>
19  );
20}

Props

PropTypeDefault
type"single" | "multiple""single"
collapsiblebooleanfalse
defaultValuestring | string[]-

Toast

Non-blocking notification messages.

Example

1import { toast, Toaster } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <>
6      <Toaster />
7      <button onClick={() => toast('Hello, world!')}>
8        Show Toast
9      </button>
10      <button onClick={() => toast.success('Saved!')}>
11        Success
12      </button>
13      <button onClick={() => toast.error('Something went wrong')}>
14        Error
15      </button>
16      <button onClick={() => toast.loading('Processing...')}>
17        Loading
18      </button>
19    </>
20  );
21}

Props

PropTypeDefault
position"top-left" | "top-center" | "top-right" | "bottom-left" | "bottom-center" | "bottom-right""bottom-right"
durationnumber4000

Tooltip

Contextual information on hover or focus.

Example

1import { Tooltip, Button } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <Tooltip content="This is helpful information">
6      <Button>Hover me</Button>
7    </Tooltip>
8  );
9}

Props

PropTypeDefault
contentstring | JSX.Element-
side"top" | "right" | "bottom" | "left""top"
delaynumber200

Dropdown

Dropdown menu with keyboard navigation.

Example

1import { Dropdown, Button } from 'philjs-ui';
2 
3function Example() {
4  return (
5    <Dropdown>
6      <Dropdown.Trigger asChild>
7        <Button>Open Menu</Button>
8      </Dropdown.Trigger>
9      <Dropdown.Content>
10        <Dropdown.Item onClick={() => console.log('Edit')}>
11          Edit
12        </Dropdown.Item>
13        <Dropdown.Item onClick={() => console.log('Duplicate')}>
14          Duplicate
15        </Dropdown.Item>
16        <Dropdown.Separator />
17        <Dropdown.Item variant="destructive">
18          Delete
19        </Dropdown.Item>
20      </Dropdown.Content>
21    </Dropdown>
22  );
23}

Props

PropTypeDefault
align"start" | "center" | "end""start"
side"top" | "right" | "bottom" | "left""bottom"

Theming

philjs-ui uses CSS variables for theming. Override these in your CSS to customize:

globals.csscss
1:root {
2  --ui-primary: 59 130 246;      /* blue-500 */
3  --ui-secondary: 100 116 139;   /* slate-500 */
4  --ui-destructive: 239 68 68;   /* red-500 */
5  --ui-background: 255 255 255;
6  --ui-foreground: 15 23 42;
7  --ui-border: 226 232 240;
8  --ui-radius: 0.5rem;
9}
10 
11.dark {
12  --ui-background: 15 23 42;
13  --ui-foreground: 248 250 252;
14  --ui-border: 51 65 85;
15}

Accessibility

i

WCAG Compliant

All philjs-ui components are built with accessibility in mind:
  • Proper ARIA attributes
  • Keyboard navigation support
  • Focus management
  • Screen reader compatible
  • Color contrast compliant
